Description: Terracotta oval-bodied hanging lamp. Slightly convex top with moulded edges. Rising from top, half-figure of Athena, wearing tunic and helmet. Back of figure unworked, pierced with small hole. Large wick-hole, no filling-hole. Three lion's feet support the lamp, the two at rear joined. Red-brown micaceous clay; traces of white and blue post-firing pigmentation. Suspension-handle on top of head lost; front foot broken away.
Curator's comments: Close: Mogensen, M., 1930. ‘La Glyptothèque Ny Carlsberg : la collection égyptienne’. Copenhagen : Levin & Munksgaard, pl. XL, A 247. Near: Perdrizet, P., 1921. ‘Les terres cuites grecques d'Égypte de al collection Fouquet’. Nancy : Berger-Levrault, pl. LIX, 172, from Memphis; Cahn-Klaiber, E.M., 1977. ‘Die antiken Tonlampen der Archäologischen Instituts der Universität Tübingen’. Tübingen, 141, from Alexandria.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1992)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (399)
Condition: incomplete - suspension-handle and front foot lost
